solution_line_template: There are a total of {single_page_spreads} single-page spreads * {double_page_spread_multiplier} = <<{single_page_spreads}*{double_page_spread_multiplier}={double_page_spreads}>>{double_page_spreads} double-page spreads.

As these are made up of {pages_per_double_spread} pages each, there are {double_page_spreads} double-page spreads * {pages_per_double_spread} pages = <<{double_page_spreads}*{pages_per_double_spread}={double_page_spread_pages}>>{double_page_spread_pages} pages in the double-page spreads.

In total, there are {single_page_spreads} single-pages + {double_page_spread_pages} double-pages = <<{single_page_spreads}+{double_page_spread_pages}={total_spread_pages}>>{total_spread_pages} pages in the spreads.

A block of ads is printed every {pages_per_block} pages, so there will be {total_spread_pages} pages / {pages_per_block} pages/block = <<{total_spread_pages}/{pages_per_block}={num_blocks}>>{num_blocks} blocks of ads.
This is a total of {num_blocks} blocks * {ads_per_block} ads = <<{num_blocks}*{ads_per_block}={total_ads}>>{total_ads} ads.
As each ad takes up a quarter of a page, this must create an additional {total_ads} ads * {ad_page_fraction} = <<{total_ads}*{ad_page_fraction}={ad_pages}>>{ad_pages} pages.
Therefore, the press has printed {total_spread_pages} pages from the spreads + {ad_pages} pages of ads = <<{total_spread_pages}+{ad_pages}={total_pages}>>{total_pages} pages.

Since brochures are made up of {pages_per_brochure} pages each, this creates a total of {total_pages} pages / {pages_per_brochure} = <<{total_pages}/{pages_per_brochure}={num_brochures}>>{num_brochures} brochures.
